intro: Chromolaena chaseae, commonly known as wild hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to yellow and red. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields. Chromolaena chaseae is also known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
